source.c360d9df:
#Writing code to work on both COLAB and KAGGLE!
#https://www.kaggle.com/aikhmelnytskyy/google-brain-with-tpu-on-both-colab-and-kaggle?scriptVersionId=77418948&cellId=5

import gc
import os
import sys

COLAB=False

if not os.path.exists('../input/ventilator-pressure-prediction'):# Let's check if we use kaggle notebook
    COLAB=True
    from google.colab import drive
    drive.mount('/content/drive')# You must grant COLAB access to your Google Drive

    from google.colab import files
    if not os.path.exists('/.kaggle/kaggle.json'):
        !mkdir ~/.kaggle
        if not os.path.exists('/content/drive/My Drive/Models/kaggle.json'):
            files.upload()
            !cp kaggle.json ~/.kaggle/
        else:
            !cp '/content/drive/My Drive/Models/kaggle.json' ~/.kaggle/  
        !chmod 600 ~/.kaggle/kaggle.json
    models_path='/content/drive/MyDrive/Models/'
    data_path='/content/drive/MyDrive/Models/'
else:
    models_path='./'
    data_path='../input/ventilator-pressure-prediction/'

source.491a2999:
#https://robertbrucecarter.com/writing/2020/06/setting-your-working-directory-to-google-drive-in-a-colab-notebook/

import os 

# Set your working directory to a folder in your Google Drive. This way, if your notebook times out,
# your files will be saved in your Google Drive!

# the base Google Drive directory
root_dir = "/content/drive/My Drive/"

# choose where you want your project files to be saved
project_folder = "Colab Notebooks/My Project Folder/"

def create_and_set_working_directory(project_folder):
  # check if your project folder exists. if not, it will be created.
  if os.path.isdir(root_dir + project_folder) == False:
    os.mkdir(root_dir + project_folder)
    print(root_dir + project_folder + ' did not exist but was created.')

  # change the OS to use your project folder as the working directory
  os.chdir(root_dir + project_folder)

  # create a test file to make sure it shows up in the right place
  !touch 'new_file_in_working_directory.txt'
  print('\nYour working directory was changed to ' + root_dir + project_folder + \
        "\n\nAn empty text file was created there. You can also run !pwd to confirm the current working directory." )

create_and_set_working_directory(project_folder)

# Run VSCode (codeserver) on Google Colab

**What is ColabCode?**
It is a Python package that allows you to start a code server right from your Colab or Kaggle notebooks without setting up anything locally on your system.

Github
https://github.com/abhishekkrthakur/colabcode

Demo
https://youtu.be/7kTbM3D02jU

Author @abhishek

source.d59c5d8c:
# The Frequently Asked Questions

![](https://i.postimg.cc/FK2b4mtw/5z4mvn.jpg)


* What is Colaboratory?
* Is it really free to use?Seems too good to be true. What are the limitations?
* What is the difference between Jupyter and Colab?
* Where are my notebooks stored, and can I share them?
* If I share my notebook, what will be shared?
* Can I import an existing Jupyter/IPython notebook into Colab?
* How can I search Colab notebooks?
* Where is my code executed? What happens to my execution state if I close the browser window?
* How can I get my data out?
* How can I reset the virtual machine(s) my code runs on, and why is this sometimes unavailable?
* Why does drive.mount() sometimes fail saying "timed out", and why do I/O operations in drive.mount()-mounted folders sometimes fail?
* Why do Drive operations sometimes fail due to quota?
* Why do Drive operations sometimes fail due to storage quota?
* Why aren’t resources guaranteed in Colab?
* What are the usage limits of Colab?
* What types of GPUs are available in Colab?
* How long can notebooks run in Colab?
* How much memory is available in Colab?
* How can I get the most out of Colab?
* I saw a message saying my GPU is not being utilized. What should I do?
* What browsers are supported?
* How is this related to colaboratory.jupyter.org?
* What about other programming languages?
* I found a bug or have a question, who do I contact?
* Why prompt to enable third-party cookies?
* How do I change the editor font?
* Does Colab support Python 2?
* Where can I learn more about Colab Pro and Pro+?
* How does billing work for Colab Pro and Colab Pro+?
* How do I access Colab with a Workspace account?

https://research.google.com/colaboratory/faq.html
